com.myspace.myspaceid
Class MySpace

java.lang.Object
  com.myspace.myspaceid.MySpace

public class MySpace
extends java.lang.Object

Class that encapsulates MySpace service against which you can perform OAuth requests as well as fetch user data.

Constructor Detail

MySpace

public MySpace(java.lang.String consumerKey,
               java.lang.String consumerSecret)
Constructor. Use this to construct a MySpace object for onsite applications (application type = ApplicationType.OFF_SITE).

Parameters:
consumerKey - Consumer key to use. You should have obtained the consumer key and consumer secret from developer.myspace.com.
consumerSecret - Consumer secret to use.

MySpace

public MySpace(java.lang.String consumerKey,
               java.lang.String consumerSecret,
               int applicationType)
Constructor. Use this to construct a MySpace object for 2 scenarios:
  • For offsite apps, use this to construcut the initial MySpace object for obtaining the request token and to obtain the authorization URL that you would use to authenticate the user.
  • For onsite apps, use this to construct the MySpace object that you can use immediately to obtain user data without needing to go through user authentication.

Parameters:
consumerKey - Consumer key to use. You should have obtained the consumer key and consumer secret from developer.myspace.com.
consumerSecret - Consumer secret to use.
applicationType - ApplicationType.ON_SITE for apps that run within MySpace, and ApplicationType.OFF_SITE for apps that run outside MySpace. See ApplicationType.

MySpace

public MySpace(java.lang.String consumerKey,
               java.lang.String consumerSecret,
               int applicationType,
               java.lang.String accessTokenKey,
               java.lang.String accessTokenSecret)
Mature constructor that accepts access token key and secret. Use to construct a mature offsite MySpace object that includes the access token key and secret. Such a "mature" MySpace object can be used to obtain the access token and user data for offsite applications. This constructor automatically assumes a value of ApplicationType.OFF_SITE for the application type.

Parameters:
consumerKey - Consumer key to use. You should have obtained the consumer key and consumer secret from developer.myspace.com.
consumerSecret - Consumer secret to use.
applicationType - ApplicationType.ON_SITE for apps that run within MySpace, and ApplicationType.OFF_SITE for apps that run outside MySpace. See ApplicationType.
accessTokenKey - Key of access token.
accessTokenSecret - Secret of access token.
Method Detail

getRequestToken

public OAuthToken getRequestToken()
Returns the request token. This should be your first step. After this, allow the user to authenticate himself by redirecting to the URL found by calling getAuthorizationURL(com.myspace.myspaceid.oauth.OAuthToken, java.lang.String).

Returns:
A request token.

getAuthorizationURL

public java.lang.String getAuthorizationURL(OAuthToken requestToken,
                                            java.lang.String callbackURL)
Returns the authorization URL that you should redirect to for the user to authenticate. After successful authentication, the user's browser is redirected back to the callback URL. The callback URL receives an oauth_token parameter that you need to pick up and then call getAccessToken(com.myspace.myspaceid.oauth.OAuthToken).

Parameters:
requestToken - The request token obtained by calling getRequestToken().
callbackURL - The callback URL that MySpace redirects the user to after she authenticates successfully.
Returns:
the authorization URL that you should redirect to for the user to authenticate.

getAccessToken

public OAuthToken getAccessToken(OAuthToken requestToken)
After successful authentication, the user's browser is redirected back to the callback URL. The callback URL receives an oauth_token parameter that you need to pick up. Create an OAuthToken object using it as key; for secret, use the previous request token's secret.

Parameters:
requestToken - A token token to use to get an access token.
Returns:
An access token; you can now start getting user data with this access token.

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getGlobalAppData()
Returns global app data for this app.

Returns:
app data.

getGlobalAppData

Parameters:
keys - semicolon-separated keys
Returns:
Values fetched for the given keys

getUserId

public java.lang.String getUserId()
Returns the id of the user for whom we have an access token. This method requires that the access token has been stored in its MySpace object. Use the "mature" constructor that takes the access token key and secret as parameters.

Returns:
the id of the user for whom we have an access token.

getAlbums

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getAlbums(java.lang.String userId)
Returns the albums of the given user. This method requires that the access token has been stored in its MySpace object.

Parameters:
userId - ID of user to query.
Returns:
the albums of the given user.

getAlbums

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getAlbums(java.lang.String userId,
                                            int page,
                                            int pageSize)
Returns the albums of the given user. This method requires that the access token has been stored in its MySpace object.

Parameters:
userId - ID of user to query.
page - Which page. Pass -1 to not specify.
pageSize - Number of items per page. Pass -1 to not specify.
Returns:
the albums of the given user.

getFriends

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getFriends(java.lang.String userId)
Returns the friends of the given user. This method requires that the access token has been stored in its MySpace object.

Parameters:
userId - ID of user to query.
Returns:
an album of the given user.

getFriends

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getFriends(java.lang.String userId,
                                             int page,
                                             int pageSize,
                                             java.lang.String list,
                                             java.lang.String show)
Returns the friends of the given user. This method requires that the access token has been stored in its MySpace object.

Parameters:
userId - ID of user to query.
page - Which page. First page is numbered '1'. Pass -1 to not specify.
pageSize - Number of items per page. Pass -1 to not specify.
list - Can be one of 'top', 'online' or 'app'
show - can be a combination of 'mood', 'status', 'online' separated by '|'. Do not put spaces in this string.
Returns:
an album of the given user.

getFriendsList

                                                 java.lang.String friends)
Returns the specified friends of the given user.

Parameters:
userId - ID of user to query.
friends - List of friend ID's separated by semicolons.
Returns:
the specified friends of the given user.

Parameters:

friends - List of friend ID's separated by semicolons.
show - can be a combination of 'mood', 'status', 'online' separated by '|'. Do not put spaces in this string.
Returns:
the specified friends of the given user.

getUser

public org.json.simple.JSONObject getUser()
Returns the current user as an object. For most calls, you would first need to call getUserId() to obtain the current user's id before you can access data.

Returns:
the current user.
